documentation.text:
@title RefundableCrowdsale
 @dev Extension of `FinalizableCrowdsale` contract that adds a funding goal, and the possibility of users
 getting a refund if goal is not met.
 Deprecated, use `RefundablePostDeliveryCrowdsale` instead. Note that if you allow tokens to be traded before the goal
 is met, then an attack is possible in which the attacker purchases tokens from the crowdsale and when they sees that
 the goal is unlikely to be met, they sell their tokens (possibly at a discount). The attacker will be refunded when
 the crowdsale is finalized, and the users that purchased from them will be left with worthless tokens.

@dev Constructor, creates RefundEscrow.
 @param goal Funding goal
@return minimum amount of funds to be raised in wei.

@dev Investors can claim refunds here if crowdsale is unsuccessful.
 @param refundee Whose refund will be claimed.

@dev Checks whether funding goal was reached.
 @return Whether funding goal was reached
@dev Escrow finalization task, called when finalize() is called.
@dev Overrides Crowdsale fund forwarding, sending funds to escrow.

@title RefundableCrowdsale
 @dev Extension of `FinalizableCrowdsale` contract that adds a funding goal, and the possibility of users
 getting a refund if goal is not met.
 Deprecated, use `RefundablePostDeliveryCrowdsale` instead. Note that if you allow tokens to be traded before the goal
 is met, then an attack is possible in which the attacker purchases tokens from the crowdsale and when they sees that
 the goal is unlikely to be met, they sell their tokens (possibly at a discount). The attacker will be refunded when
 the crowdsale is finalized, and the users that purchased from them will be left with worthless tokens.

@dev Constructor, creates RefundEscrow.
 @param goal Funding goal
@return minimum amount of funds to be raised in wei.

@dev Investors can claim refunds here if crowdsale is unsuccessful.
 @param refundee Whose refund will be claimed.

@dev Checks whether funding goal was reached.
 @return Whether funding goal was reached
@dev Escrow finalization task, called when finalize() is called.
@dev Overrides Crowdsale fund forwarding, sending funds to escrow.

devdoc.details: Extension of `FinalizableCrowdsale` contract that adds a funding goal, and the possibility of users getting a refund if goal is not met. Deprecated, use `RefundablePostDeliveryCrowdsale` instead. Note that if you allow tokens to be traded before the goal is met, then an attack is possible in which the attacker purchases tokens from the crowdsale and when they sees that the goal is unlikely to be met, they sell their tokens (possibly at a discount). The attacker will be refunded when the crowdsale is finalized, and the users that purchased from them will be left with worthless tokens.

buyTokens(address).details: low level token purchase ***DO NOT OVERRIDE*** This function has a non-reentrancy guard, so it shouldn't be called by another `nonReentrant` function.

claimRefund(address).details: Investors can claim refunds here if crowdsale is unsuccessful.

finalize().details: Must be called after crowdsale ends, to do some extra finalization work. Calls the contract's finalization function.

returns._0: true if the crowdsale is finalized, false otherwise.
minimum amount of funds to be raised in wei.

goalReached().details: Checks whether funding goal was reached.

hasClosed().details: Checks whether the period in which the crowdsale is open has already elapsed.

returns._0: true if the crowdsale is open, false otherwise.
the number of token units a buyer gets per wei.
the address where funds are collected.

devdoc.title: RefundableCrowdsale
